page.title: 13A DOCTOR'S DAY: Dr Hoyland
page.content: I get up at 7 o'clock, when the alarm rings and then make the early morning tea. I read for about 45 minutes, then open up the greenhouse in the garden then have breakfast. I set off for the surgery and, at about 8.15 I look at my post and papers. I see patients until 11am,on average about 20 to 25 a day. Next I sign letters and write prescriptions. I visit people who are too ill to come to the surgery, returning for lunch at 1pm. I go to the hospital in the afternoon and do an operating list at 2pm, followed by a ward round. Tea is at home or at the surgery, followed by Evening Surgery at 5pm.I go home and watch the news, have an early supper, then this evening I sing for 2 hours in Gloucester Cathedral. When I return home I play the piano.
